2022-10-26.name: Halloween
2022-10-26.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2022-10-27.name: Halloween
2022-10-27.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2022-10-28.name: Halloween
2022-10-28.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2022-10-28.name: Halloween Outdoor Puppet Extravaganza
2022-10-28.summary:
The BareBones puppet troupe's annual pageant will be held on the Midtown Greenway this year, with music, dance, stilt-walking, fire and song.
To be sure of tickets, reserve ahead.

2022-10-29.name: Halloween
2022-10-29.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2022-10-29.name: Arts in the Dark Halloween parade
2022-10-29.summary: Floats, giant puppets and performances are part of the 6-8 p.m. parade along State Street.

2022-10-29.name: Jack O'Lantern Days
2022-10-29.summary: There will be mask making, pumpkin carving, trick or treating and haunted trolley tours.

2022-10-29.name: BatFest
2022-10-29.summary: This Fox River town hosts a pumpkin roll, pumpkin-carving battles, "Thriller'' dances, marshmallow shooting and a parade.

2022-10-29.name: Mount Carroll Pumpkin Fest
2022-10-29.summary: In this northwest Illinois town, there will be a costume parade, pumpkin bowling, pumpkin slingshot and pumpkin street drag races.

2022-10-29.name: Halloween Outdoor Puppet Extravaganza
2022-10-29.summary:
The BareBones puppet troupe's annual pageant will be held on the Midtown Greenway this year, with music, dance, stilt-walking, fire and song.
To be sure of tickets, reserve ahead.

2022-10-29.name: Halloween Parade
2022-10-29.summary: The town's annual parade along Main Street starts at 6:30 p.m.

2022-10-29.name: UFO Day
2022-10-29.summary: There's a craft fair, kids' games and music, but the 1 p.m. parade is the main event in this riverside village just south of Madison, where residents reported more than a dozen UFO sightings in the winter of 1987.

2022-10-29.name: Day of the Dead Xicago
2022-10-29.summary: In the National Museum of Mexican Art and Harrison Park, families can create ofrendas (altars), eat pan de muerto, listen to musical performances and get faces painted. Admission is free.

2022-10-29.name: Day of the Dead
2022-10-29.summary: In Old Town Mankato along Riverfront Drive, there will be a mariachi band, Aztec and folklore dancers, a Mexican wrestling ring, a makers' market and children's activities and treats.

2022-10-30.name: Halloween Outdoor Puppet Extravaganza
2022-10-30.summary:
The BareBones puppet troupe's annual pageant will be held on the Midtown Greenway this year, with music, dance, stilt-walking, fire and song.
To be sure of tickets, reserve ahead.

2022-10-22.name: Halloween
2022-10-22.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2022-10-22.name: Chicago International Film Festival
2022-10-22.summary: Watch more than 80 films and 60 programs of shorts from around the world.

2022-10-22.name: Moose Madness Festival
2022-10-22.summary: This Lake Superior town  offers a medallion hunt, scavenger hunt, sled-dog open house, games led by Murray the Moose and activities at North House Folk School.

2022-10-22.name: Family Fall Fest
2022-10-22.summary: On the largest of the Apostle Islands, there will be a vintage-car show, cider- and soap-making, pumpkin decorating, a pie-eating contest, street vendors and a kids' costume parade.

2022-10-22.name: Earth Wood & Fire Artist Tour
2022-10-22.summary: Visit artists in their studios in and around Lake Mills, Cambridge and Fort Atkinson, between Madison and Milwaukee.

2022-10-22.name: Oktoberfest
2022-10-22.summary: Carlos Creek Winery's brewing partner, 22 Northmen, hosts this festival, which includes a stein-holding contest, stein relays, nail-striking, axe-throwing and live bands.

2022-10-22.name: Scarecrow Festival
2022-10-22.summary: This town in northwest Illinois offers scarecrow and doughnut-eating contests, pumpkin racing, a petting zoo and a band concert.

2022-10-23.name: Halloween
2022-10-23.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2022-10-23.name: Chicago International Film Festival
2022-10-23.summary: Watch more than 80 films and 60 programs of shorts from around the world.

2022-10-23.name: Earth Wood & Fire Artist Tour
2022-10-23.summary: Visit artists in their studios in and around Lake Mills, Cambridge and Fort Atkinson, between Madison and Milwaukee.

2022-10-23.name: Witches & Wizards of Woodstock
2022-10-23.summary: This all-ages fantasy festival in Woodstock Square features a magical talking hat, Quidditch training, an owlery, a wandering magician, a cosplay scavenger hunt and a costume parade and contest.

2022-10-24.name: Halloween
2022-10-24.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2022-10-25.name: Halloween
2022-10-25.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2022-10-01.name: Grundy County Corn Festival
2022-10-01.summary: The festival in this town on the Illinois River between Ottawa and Joliet offers stagecoach and train rides, a crackerbox derby, a pie-eating contest, music, a carnival, Saturday fireworks and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2022-10-01.name: World Music Festival
2022-10-01.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues

2022-10-01.name: Fermentation Fest
2022-10-01.summary: This fest in the scenic hills of southwest Wisconsin is not only about pickles and sourdough bread but also cheese, chocolate, beer and wine. There will be demos, tastings, music, art, dance, plus the 50-mile Farm/Art DTour through farmland dotted with art installations, food markets, roadside poetry and pop-up events.

2022-10-01.name: Oktoberfest
2022-10-01.summary: At this big riverfront festival, there's food, music and carnival rides, plus the opening Torchlight Parade and the Maple Leaf Parade on Saturday morning.

2022-10-01.name: Oktoberfest
2022-10-01.summary: There's German music and food at this Amana Colonies village, plus contests that include the Eisenmann, or Iron Man, competition: Teams roll kegs, walk a balance beam with full steins of beer and saw logs. The parade is at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2022-10-01.name: Northeast Iowa Artists' Studio Tour
2022-10-01.summary: Drive through scenic bluff country to see 42 artists at             31 sites around Decorah, Burr Oak, St. Lucas, Waukon, West Union, Cresco, New Albin, Lansing, Elgin and Clermont.

2022-10-01.name: Door County Fall Lighthouse Festival
2022-10-01.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum sponsors tours by air, land and water to lighthouses on the peninsula, some of which can be visited only during festival weekends. Reserve as early as possible.

2022-10-01.name: Apple Affair
2022-10-01.summary: In the bluffs above Trempealeau, this festival features a 10-foot apple pie, a hunt for a Silver Apple, a race of floating wooden apples and a bicycle tour with a 20-mile route through apple orchards and hillier 35- and 60-mile routes.

2022-10-01.name: Oktoberfest
2022-10-01.summary: This festival just north of Milwaukee features music and food plus             goofy contests: best lederhosen/dirndl, sauerkraut-eating, a German spelling bee and a live Glockenspiel show.

2022-10-01.name: Giant Pumpkin Fest
2022-10-01.summary: This town near Wisconsin Rapids calls itself the Giant Pumpkin Capital of Wisconsin and features a pumpkin-pie eating contest, pumpkin rolling and carving, a carnival and craft show.

2022-10-01.name: Fall Village Market
2022-10-01.summary: This town west of Madison offers vintage and handmade goods, live music and food trucks.

2022-10-01.name: Rivertown Fall Art  Festival
2022-10-01.summary: This juried arts festival along the banks of the St. Croix River includes music and food vendors.

2022-10-01.name: Cranberry Fest
2022-10-01.summary: In this northeast Wisconsin lakes town, there will be marsh tours, music, a cranberry beer and wine garden, an antiques market, fiber-art show and crafts fair.

2022-10-01.name: Big Island Rendezvous and Festival
2022-10-01.summary: This southern Minnesota festival is great for families, with a voyageur encampment of more than 1,000 reenactors dancing, demonstrating, competing and pulling visitors back into the fur-trade era.

2022-10-01.name: Autumn on Parade
2022-10-01.summary: There's a market, Fun Zone for kids, classic car and tractor show, entertainment stage, beer garden and a parade at 1 p.m. Sunday.

2022-10-01.name: Oktoberfest
2022-10-01.summary: The Lions Club puts on this riverfront festival, which includes wiener-dog races, polka lessons, nail-driving, pumpkin-decorating and a beanbag tournament.

2022-10-01.name: Autumnfest
2022-10-01.summary: This town on the St. Croix River offers live music, a car show, food trucks and an arts and crafts fair in Overlook Park.

2022-10-01.name: World Music Festival
2022-10-01.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues.

2022-10-01.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2022-10-01.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2022-10-02.summary: This town on the St. Croix River offers live music, a car show, food trucks and an arts and crafts fair in Overlook Park.

2022-10-07.name: World Music Festival
2022-10-07.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues

2022-10-07.name: Fermentation Fest
2022-10-07.summary: This fest in the scenic hills of southwest Wisconsin is not only about pickles and sourdough bread but also cheese, chocolate, beer and wine. There will be demos, tastings, music, art, dance, plus the 50-mile Farm/Art DTour through farmland dotted with art installations, food markets, roadside poetry and pop-up events.

2022-10-07.name: Apple Festival
2022-10-07.summary: It's the 61st year of this big festival on Lake Superior, which features  orchard tours, history  walks, an apple-peeling contest, live music and a big parade at 2 p.m.  Sunday.

2022-10-07.name: Scarecrow Festival
2022-10-07.summary: There's a big scarecrow contest plus a             carnival, music, dance and the Autumn on the Fox arts show in this town west of Chicago. New this year is the Family Zone.

2022-10-07.name: Pumpkin Festival
2022-10-07.summary: Every year, this northern suburb of Chicago tries to break the record for most lighted jack-o-lanterns. In addition to all-you-can-carve stations, there will be costume, pie-eating and carving contests.

2022-10-07.name: Covered Bridge Studio Tour
2022-10-07.summary: This studio tour in eastern Wisconsin includes more than 60 artists in Cedarburg, Grafton, Port Washington, Mequon, Thiensville and Newburg.

2022-10-07.name: Twin Cities Oktoberfest
2022-10-07.summary: This festival at the Minnesota State Fairgrounds features craft beer, music, dancing and such competitions as stein-holding and nail-striking.

2022-10-07.name: Chain O' Lakes Blues Festival
2022-10-07.summary: Listen to the blues at the historic Indian Crossing Casino.

2022-10-07.name: Oktoberfest
2022-10-07.summary: There will be music, food and free pumpkins on downtown streets.

2022-10-07.name: World Music Festival
2022-10-07.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues.

2022-10-07.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2022-10-07.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2022-10-08.name: World Music Festival
2022-10-08.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues

2022-10-08.name: Fermentation Fest
2022-10-08.summary: This fest in the scenic hills of southwest Wisconsin is not only about pickles and sourdough bread but also cheese, chocolate, beer and wine. There will be demos, tastings, music, art, dance, plus the 50-mile Farm/Art DTour through farmland dotted with art installations, food markets, roadside poetry and pop-up events.

2022-10-08.name: Apple Festival
2022-10-08.summary: It's the 61st year of this big festival on Lake Superior, which features  orchard tours, history  walks, an apple-peeling contest, live music and a big parade at 2 p.m.  Sunday.

2022-10-08.name: Scarecrow Festival
2022-10-08.summary: There's a big scarecrow contest plus a             carnival, music, dance and the Autumn on the Fox arts show in this town west of Chicago. New this year is the Family Zone.

2022-10-08.name: Pumpkin Festival
2022-10-08.summary: Every year, this northern suburb of Chicago tries to break the record for most lighted jack-o-lanterns. In addition to all-you-can-carve stations, there will be costume, pie-eating and carving contests.

2022-10-08.name: Covered Bridge Studio Tour
2022-10-08.summary: This studio tour in eastern Wisconsin includes more than 60 artists in Cedarburg, Grafton, Port Washington, Mequon, Thiensville and Newburg.

2022-10-08.name: Twin Cities Oktoberfest
2022-10-08.summary: This festival at the Minnesota State Fairgrounds features craft beer, music, dancing and such competitions as stein-holding and nail-striking.

2022-10-08.name: Galena Country Fair
2022-10-08.summary: There's a juried fine arts/arts and crafts fair, farmers market, wine garden, bake shop, music and children's games in Grant Park.

2022-10-08.name: Scenic Drive Festival
2022-10-08.summary: In the southeast corner of Iowa, 11 villages feature quilt shows, scarecrow contests, bake sales, tours of             historic sites, wine tasting and street fairs.

2022-10-08.name: Burgoo Festival
2022-10-08.summary: The street party in this northern Illinois town, gateway to Starved Rock State Park, features vats of "pioneer'' stew, a crafts fair and music.

2022-10-08.name: Harvest Fest
2022-10-08.summary: In this river town, there will be a pumpkin pie-eating contest, a pumpkin regatta on the St. Croix, a microbrew tasting and a pedal tractor pull.

2022-10-08.name: Jack O' Lantern Festival
2022-10-08.summary: There's a pumpkin-carving and scarecrow-making contests, kids' inflatables, pumpkin roll and, in the evening, a zombie run in the forest, bonfires and live music.

2022-10-08.name: Harvest Fest
2022-10-08.summary: On the 400 Block downtown, there will be free pumpkins, kids' tractor pulls, a petting zoo and other children's activities.

2022-10-08.name: Red Wing Arts Fall Festival
2022-10-08.summary: More than 100 artist booths line four blocks of this Mississippi River town. There's also music and food.

2022-10-08.name: Chain O' Lakes Blues Festival
2022-10-08.summary: Listen to the blues at the historic Indian Crossing Casino.

2022-10-08.name: Northside Oktoberfest
2022-10-08.summary: The Iowa City Brewfest is part of this festival, which includes keg  bowling, beer sliding and nail-striking as well as traditional Oktoberfest music in an outdoor beer hall.

2022-10-08.name: Madison County Covered Bridge Festival
2022-10-08.summary: John Wayne was born there, George Washington Carver lived there and the famous covered bridges still are there. The festival in this town southwest of Des Moines features guided bus tours to the bridges, free horse-drawn wagon rides to Wayne's house, Old West shootouts, live music and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2022-10-08.name: Pumpkin Patch Festival
2022-10-08.summary: There'll be music, children's games and arts and crafts in this Door County village.

2022-10-08.name: Oktoberfest
2022-10-08.summary: There will be music, food and free pumpkins on downtown streets.

2022-10-08.name: Civil War Immersion Weekend at Norskedalen
2022-10-08.summary: This pioneer farmstead in the coulees southeast of La Crosse is wonderfully atmospheric, and the crackerjack re-enactors of the Second Wisconsin Volunteer Infantry's Company B give the region's most affecting portrayal of war. Skirmishes will be at 11 a.m. and 2 p.m.

2022-10-08.name: Shadows of the Blue and Gray
2022-10-08.summary: This Civil War festival off I-80, half an hour west of Starved Rock  State Park, includes battle re-enactments both days.

2022-10-08.name: Harvest & Wine Festival
2022-10-08.summary: This Lake Michigan beach town offers wine and craft-beer tasting, hay rides, pumpkin painting, live music and fine arts.

2022-10-08.name: World Music Festival
2022-10-08.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues.

2022-10-08.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2022-10-08.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2022-10-09.name: World Music Festival
2022-10-09.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues

2022-10-09.name: Fermentation Fest

2022-10-09.summary: This Civil War festival off I-80, half an hour west of Starved Rock  State Park, includes battle re-enactments both days.

2022-10-09.name: Harvest Fest
2022-10-09.summary: See old-time artisanry at the Swiss Historical Village, including sausage-stuffing and cheese-making in the 1890s cheese factory.

2022-10-09.name: World Music Festival
2022-10-09.summary: More than 80 artists perform at more than 30 venues.

2022-10-09.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2022-10-09.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

There will be demos, tastings, music, art, dance, plus the 50-mile Farm/Art DTour through farmland dotted with art installations, food markets, roadside poetry and pop-up events.

2022-10-10.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2022-10-10.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2022-10-14.name: Fall Festival
2022-10-14.summary: This Door County festival features pumpkin bowling, a derby race, chainsaw carving, a  pingpong-ball drop and a parade at 11 a.m. Saturday.

2022-10-14.summary: This popular studio tour includes artists at studios between Mineral Point, Spring Green, Dodgeville and Baraboo.

2022-10-14.name: Mystery at the Fur Post
2022-10-14.summary: Solve the annual mystery during "Blood Between the Book Ends'' at the re-created Snake River (formerly North West Company) Fur Post, an hour north of the Twin Cities. The program is family-friendly, and reservations are recommended.

2022-10-14.name: Mississippi Headwaters Fest
2022-10-14.summary: This music festival, two miles north of the north entrance to Itasca State Park, features yoga, fire dancing and hiking in addition to blues bands and tributes to Roy Orbison, Sheryl Crow and other artists.

2022-10-21.name: Moose Madness Festival
2022-10-21.summary: This Lake Superior town  offers a medallion hunt, scavenger hunt, sled-dog open house, games led by Murray the Moose and activities at North House Folk School.

2022-10-31.name: Halloween Outdoor Puppet Extravaganza
2022-10-31.summary:
The BareBones puppet troupe's annual pageant will be held on the Midtown Greenway this year, with music, dance, stilt-walking, fire and song.
To be sure of tickets, reserve ahead.
